snippet: The rule would exempt broad swaths of energy companies, hedge funds and banks from oversight, with firms avoiding scrutiny if they annually arranged less than $8 billion worth of swaps.
abstract: The rule would exempt broad swaths of energy companies, hedge funds and banks from oversight, with firms avoiding scrutiny if they annually arranged less than $8 billion worth of swaps.

headline.main: Regulators to Ease a Rule on Derivatives Dealers
headline.print_headline: Regulators to Ease a Rule On Derivatives Dealers
